attributes.action: hold a legally binding (ie the outcome will legally be required to be acted upon) referendum to ask the voting population of this country whether they are prepared to continue to allow their employees (Members of Parliament) to have discrete voting rights over their own pay and allowances and whether or not those same employees should be able to vote themselves exemption for any form of legal obligation to demonstrate lawful and proper use of public funds in pursuit of their political activities.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Members of Parliament are employees of the people who voted and pay they salaries and allowances.  No other group of employees has sole voting rights on their own salary, allowances and liability to external oversight.  Members of Parliament have recently demonstrated they have no regard for the probity of their position so the people must be given an opportunity to vote, in a binding referendum, as to whether or not the unique situation our employees have forged for themselves should be allowed to continue into the future.
